title: 820-00165 water damage
message:
Hi, I´m working on this board, was liquid damage

PP3V3_G3H=8.58v
pp3v42_g3h=3.4v
pp3v3_S5=3.35V
PP5V_S0=5.15
L3095=0V
L7701=0V

Fan spin ok

title: 820-00165 water damage
message:
Do you get L7310/20 voltage?
PLT_RESET_L comes high?

Where was the liquid spilled?

title: 820-00165 water damage
message:
L7310=1.8v
L7320=1.8v
PLT_RESET_L=3.35v
water around C7841 but no corrosion, no damage around,only marks of dried water

title: 820-00165 water damage
message: Check for USB activity, on both ports.

title: 820-00165 water damage
message: I put it all together and when i push the power button now it shows on the screen battery icon with low red battery at 20.13v and 0.047 A to 0.615 A and then its turn off and no green or yellow light on the charger

title: 820-00165 water damage
message: ok , I started in SMC bypass mode and the laptop start normally with the fan at max speed, and when I restarted  shows the same screen with the low battery sign,  so what do you suggest?

title: 820-00165 water damage
message:
20V power for an Air, why???
Don't you have original 45W Magsafe 2 charger?
It should work with 60/85W too, but none of them will send out 20V!!!

title: 820-00165 water damage
message: I have one USB-C 85 w original apple charger and I use a USB-C tester with one T-tip adapter

title: 820-00165 water damage
message: also I have the original adapter for this mac but is the same results

title: 820-00165 water damage
message:
Use original charger, or lab PSU with less than 18V; preferible 15-16V.
20V triggers SMC_DCIN_VSENSE.
This is the reason why machine starts in SMC bypass only.

title: 820-00165 water damage
message: ok, I use now a 60W MacSafe2 and PPDCIN_G3H= 16.53v and PP5V_S4RS3=5.16v but no green or yellow light and shows the screen with the low battery

title: 820-00165 water damage
message:
What is the exact PPBUS_G3H voltage?
Check it w/ and w/o battery connected.

Did you try known good LIO board/flex?

title: 820-00165 water damage
message:
changed the  LIO board/flex for a new one and Its work OK!!   the USB-C tester with one T-tip adapter from china sucks!
Men, you are the BEST! thank you very much!
